message: Allow anyone to renew a name
Added unit tests and price oracle
Refactored base registrar to incorporate transfer logic
Make the .eth registrar an ERC721 token, using OpenZeppelin
Require names to be 183 days old before migration
Add indexed label parameter to NameRegistered and NameRenewed events
Use xor and make constants private
Fix issue 3.2 SimplePriceOracle.price is susceptible to integer overflow
Fix issue 3.3: ETHRegistrarController.register is vulnerable to front running
Resolve issue 3.13: StablePriceOracle.price has an unimportant integer underflow
Resolve issue 3.15: StringUtils.strlen could be rewritten without assembly
Fix issue 3.9: BaseRegistrarImplementation.acceptRegistrarTransfer should probably use the live modifier
Resolve issue 3.14: ETHRegistrarController.register should revert rather than silently fail
Reduce lock period to 28 days, and expose it publicly as a variable. Mitigates 3.8 and 3.12 from the audit
Set min commitment time to 10 minutes, and maximum to 24 hours
Explicitly take the previous registrar as a constructor argument
Add functionality to let the owner set the resolver record
Add function for the owner to set commitment age
Draft a contract for the short name claims process
Remove DNSSEC from short name claims contract
Accept an email parameter to claims
Use a boolean instead of enum to setClaimStatus
Fixed bug counting unresolved claims when a user withdraws
Refactor getTokenId into its own function
Add an owner to the ShortNameAuctionController and let it set the opensea address

Prepare ETHRegistrar for 3-letter (and longer) names (#40)

* Allow shorter domains (3 characters or longer).

* Initial support for registration with configuration.

* Move non-config makeCommit logic to config makeCommit.

* Updated per @arachnid comments.

* Moved internal function to end of Contrat (per @decanus).

* Bump version of resolvers

* Reuse registerWithConfig for register impl

* Move 'secret' to the end of the new commitment format

* Add more tests, and prohibit invalid commitments

Reclaim before transfer (#45)

* Reclaim before transfer

* Bump up the version to 1.2.9
Allow name registration without updating the registry
Remove code relating to the legacy registrar from the BaseRegistrar
Add support for migrating auction registrar names over
Fix ERC165 identifier for ERC721 token interface
Move unnecessary deps into a separate contract
Add support for migrating subdomain-registrar names
Don't do subdomain registrar migration if there is no old subdomain registrar
Fix bug with solidity checks on return type for setSubnodeOwner

upgrade/tests (#7)

* renamed files, using time function from helper

* upgraded

* updates

* fixes

* fix

* fix

* fix

* Update TestBaseRegistrar.js

Update the controller to support referrals and bulk renewals (#50)

* Support bulk renewal

* Add referral support to the registrar controller

* Changes in response to review

This reverts commit 7d2a68430d62004acbf7a30032ac5dd162f1c8f2.

Bulkrenewal 2 (#51)

* Implement bulk renewal contract

* Fix tests broken by different tx return type

* Check for excess funds returned

* v2.0.2

Co-authored-by: Nick Johnson <arachnid@notdot.net>

Refactor price oracles and introduce a linear premium price oracle (#53)

* Refactor price oracle

* Combine BasePriceOracle and StablePriceOracle

* Refactor out inclusion of BaseRegistrar

* Implement a linear premium price oracle

* Add tests for timeUntilPremium

* Changes in response to review

* More changes in response to review.

* Fix timeUntilPremium to operate on wei instead of attousd

* Add supportsInterface

Refactor to use chainlink oracle (#55)

* Refactor to use chainlink oracle

* Fix bulk renewal test

* Update block count in a week (#891)

* feat: implement BlocksInWeek script task

The BlocksInWeek task provides a very close approximate of number of
blocks mined during one week.

Supported networks: mainnnet, sepolia.

Example usage:

npx tsx scripts/task/task.ts BlocksInWeek --network=mainnet
npx tsx scripts/task/task.ts BlocksInWeek --network=sepolia

Resolves: https://github.com/sherlock-audit/2023-12-ubiquity-judging/issues/230

* feat: update weekly block count to 49930

Set weekly block count to 49930 as measured in February 2024

npx tsx scripts/task/task.ts BlocksInWeek --network=mainnet
...
Calculating number of blocks in the last week...
Recent average block time: 12 seconds
Estimated blocks in a week best case 50400
Produced 49930 blocks, 470 worst than the best case

Resolves: https://github.com/sherlock-audit/2023-12-ubiquity-judging/issues/230

update PangoChef

* Fix non-reverting calls:
  * try/catch revert on incorrect return value,
  * call can revert due to gas griefing with long return values,
  * only assembly level call, or try/catch with helper contract can
    be safe,
  * gas griefing at the end of the execution is not an issue due to
    EIP-150 which says 1/64 of the gas is not forwarded.

* Replace compoundToPoolZero with compoundTo
  * Can compoundTo any pool that is a PGL pair with PNG as one of the
    reserve tokens,
  * Cannot call compoundTo on a pool that can compound itself.

* Other interface changes:
  * User.lockCount (uint56) replaces User.isLockingPoolZero (uint8):
    * User can exit from the pool only if lockCount is zero.
  * New method "function getLockedPools(uint256 poolId, address
    userId) external view returns (uint256[] memory);"
    can be used to get the list of pools that the `poolId` is
    locking.

ensure swap router refunds unused eth

use internal function for refunding eth

add reward tracking to v2 contracts

* pools now have "reward rate"
* factory owner can set reward rate of a pool
* reward rate is used to calculate reward per active liquidity
  accumulator
* Oracle library is used to update reward per active liquidity
* Tick library snapshots the accumulator value outside each tick

* nft/liquidity manager contract keeps track of the delta of the
  reward per active liquidity accumulator for each position
* it holds the address of a separate contract which can be called
  from the nft manager to notify and claim the pending rewards of a
  user
* factory owner can change the contract that will distribute the rewards
* factory owner can also change nft descriptor

* pools now use clones to reduce storage size
* immutable pool variables are not immutable anymore due to proxy
  limitations

* nft manager contract optimizer run steps have been reduced to
  decrease storage size
* various little tricks has also been utilized reduce storage size,
  such as using internal functions inside modifiers

What is updated in NUS contract:

Added Pausable by OpenZeppelin
https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/utils/Pausable.sol
 - contract Pausable is added
 - contract is paused on creation (line 172)
 - modifier whenNotPaused is added to approve / permit / transfer / transferFrom / delegate / delegateBySig / burnTokens / burnByWeth functions

Added contract upgrade feature (borrowed from USDT contract)
 - added interface UpgradedStandardToken with three methods: transferByLegacy / transferFromByLegacy / approveByLegacy
 - added bool 'deprecated'
 - added address 'upgradedAddress'
 - 'deprecated' property is checked every time on transfer / transferFrom / approve calling.
   If it is not depricated, then regular execution. If it is depricated, then calling transferByLegacy / transferFromByLegacy / approveByLegacy on updated contract.
 - 'deprecated' property is checked every time on allowance / balanceOf reading.
   If it is not depricated, then regular data fetching. If it is depricated, then getting allowance / balanceOf from the updated contract.
 - added function deprecate() by contract owner

feat: Add trigger profit for rebalancing ops

Introduces a trigger profit threshold to initiate the rebalancing operation, minimum profit threshold is now used to revert operations if profits fall below this limit

Implement reserve-based profit triggers for pool rebalancing in Arbiter

- Shift profit evaluation for rebalancing triggers from fixed USD values to a dynamic ratio of pair reserves to generated profit.

- Replace 'Arbiter__InvalidMinProfit' error with 'Arbiter__InvalidProfitToReservesRatio' to align with the new reserve-based logic.

- Modify 'minProfitUSD' and 'triggerProfitUSD' parameters to 'reserveToMinProfit' and 'reserveToTriggerProfit', indicating the minimum and trigger profit ratios relative to pool reserves.

- Adapt unit and integration tests to validate the new reserve-based profit calculations for pool rebalancing operations.

[Feature] [Security] implement a flashloan architecture (#12)

This pr introduces a flashloan to the vault. A flashloan allows a beneficial owner of a vault to
"borrow" an asset, perform some action with it, and return it to the vault all in one block.

It is essential to the financial properties of the protocol that the beneficial owner is unable 
to "steal" their asset while an entitlement is in place, and the flashloan is one of the 
high-risk vector for stealing an asset. In particular, many NFTs utilize an approval scheme whereby
the owners of an asset may delegate the ability to transfer it to another address, who can later
(in a different block) transfer the asset on their behalf. If it were possible for an approval to
be granted, the owner would be able to effectively steal the asset from the vault in a later block;
however, in our case we believe this is very unlikely becauase while the owner has control of the asset
it will appear to be "owned" by the flashloanreceiver address, not the actual vault. 

We include a variety of tests with many different flashloan reciever sample contracts here.

within the vaults

[Feature] [Gas] create a multi-asset ERC-721 vault (#22)

This vault takes a similar form to our current ERC-721 vault; however, instead of 
requiring that a unique vault be deployed for each underlying ERC-721 token, this single
vault can support multiple tokenIds each with a distinct entitlement and a beneficial owner.

We believe this will result in substantial gas savings by removing the requirement that a
new vault is deployed for each minted option. Additionally, more care is taken in this
implementation to remove extraneous SSTOREs.

One area where we could get further SSTORE improvements would be by thining the 
entitlement struct that we persist to not include the notion of the vault address, as the
vault adderss is the same for each asset within the vault.

Co-authored-by: tarafans <tarafans7@gmail.com>

bid pools (#88)

A contract that allows a user to bid on a Hook Protocol option based on an implied volatility number. The actual purchase price paid for the option is computed at order fill time, using the then-current underlying asset spot price and time to option expiration.

Use Case
Bidding on options within an order book is complicated because the fair market value of that option changes rapidly based on external factors: the price of the underlying collection, the time to expiration, and other news. Typically, this can be solved by submitting orders to an order book for a short duration, and quickly canceling them if news occurs.

For casual users, these strategies are difficult because they require constant monitoring of the market, expertise in pricing transactions to cancel orders suddenly, and potential infrastructure to programmatically submit orders.

By making a longer duration order in terms of a desired implied volatility, and then computing the actual purchase price at order fill time using Black-Scholes-Merton, a user can make an order that expresses their view of the volatility quickly.

Implementation details
These orders depend on a single off-chain price oracle. The advantage of this oracle is that it can take into account order book states that may exist only off-chain (i.e., has not yet materialized in trades) and incorporate that into the view of the price. The downside is that the off-chain oracle must be trusted by the signer.

The order book offers gasless cancellations by only filling orders confirmed by a trusted oracle for a short period of time after that oracle signs the order. Off-chain, the order maker can signal to the oracle that they'd like their order to be canceled. The oracle then stops signing orders. Makers may also cancel an order by submitting a transaction on-chain.

Dependencies
The implementation depends on the well-tested BlackScholes logic used in Lyra protocol, which itself depends on the Synthetix implementation. These contracts will be out of scope for an audit.

Tests
Previously, we completed coverage testing using npx hardhat coverage. However, since this suite was completed, forge coverage has been released. Including this contract and going forward, we're aiming to meet our coverage requirements by writing tests in Solidity.

Coverage for this contract can be computed by looking at the ./HookBidPool.sol file in the forge coverage output.

Additionally, it is easier/better to ensure that EIP-712 signatures are compliant using the Hardhat coverage test system. Additional tests have been added to integration.t.js to ensure that signatures are encoded and decoded correctly.

Modified Files
Core Logic:

src/HookBidPool.sol: this is the main new contract, which controls the HookBidPools as described above.
src/interfaces/IHookOption.sol: our existing options comply with this interface, and we'd like to also make all new option types in the future comply with it. It has the most generic form of option information.
src/lib/PoolOrders.sol: order structs and EIP helpers for the new pool order types.
Dependencies:

src/interfaces/zeroex-v4/IPropertyValidator.sol: 0x protocol's property validator interface
src/lib/lyra/BlackScholes.sol: Lyra's Black Scholes calculator
src/lib/lyra/FixedPointMathLib.sol: FixedPointMath for Black Scholes
src/lib/lyra/Math.sol: Regular math for Black Scholes. ABS Value also used by skew in the PoolOrders.sol file
src/lib/synthetix/DecimalMath.sol: Decimal Math required by Black Scholes
src/lib/synthetix/SignedDecimalMath.sol: Signed Decimal math required by Black Scholes
